description: A male subject riding his bicycle in the 1000 block West Ave. reported being assaulted by the driver of a vehicle at 3:05 p.m. May 29. Springfield Township Detective Bridget McCarthy is investigating. A witness at CVS, 700 block Baltimore Pike, reported observing a male subject conceal items of merchandise under his shirt and walk out of the store without paying...
text:
Assault

A male subject riding his bicycle in the 1000 block West Ave. reported being
assaulted by the driver of a vehicle at 3:05 p.m. May 29. The male said the
driver had honked his horn at him while he was riding, and he responded to the
driver. The driver then stopped his vehicle and struck the male with his fist.
The driver re-entered his vehicle and drove away. The male suffered minor
injury. Springfield Township Detective Bridget McCarthy is investigating.

Criminal Mischief

A resident of the 100 block Grandview Rd. reported May 26 that sometime over
the weekend someone damaged his mailbox. Witnesses observed a group of
juveniles in the area when the mailbox was damaged.

Retail Theft

A witness at CVS, 700 block Baltimore Pike, reported observing a male subject
conceal items of merchandise under his shirt and walk out of the store without
paying for the merchandise at 1:58 p.m., May 29. The male was observed
entering a bus to leave the area. A short distance away the bus was stopped by
police and the male identified. Over $375 worth of merchandise was recovered,
and the 29-year-old male resident of Chester was taken into custody. He was
charged with Retail Theft and held for arraignment.Target security, 800 block
of Baltimore Pike, reported a male subject walked out of the store with
clothing and failed to pay at 10:04 a.m. May 18. Officers responded and
located the subject on Baltimore Pike. Over $430 worth of merchandise was
recovered, and a 50-year-old male resident of Philadelphia was taken
intocustody and brought to arraignment. He was charged with Retail
Theft.Springfield Officers responded to CVS, 300 block of Baltimore Pike, May
19 at 6:32 p.m., for a report of a theft that had just taken place involving
two females stealing over $130 worth of merchandise. Both females left the
property in a vehicle. A short time later Officer Bergman located the vehicle
involved parked in the lot of Target, 800 block Baltimore Pike. He waited and
observed the two females from the CVS theft walk to the vehicle. He identified
the females, recovered the items from CVS and found they had just stolen
merchandise from Target as well. The 29-year-old female resident of
Philadelphia was found to have an active arrest warrant out of Delaware County
and was transported to the prison. The other 31-year-old female resident of
Philadelphia, was released from the scene, and both will be charged with
Retail Theft.

DUI

Officers responded to the Springfield Park Shopping Center parking lot, 800
block Baltimore Pike, on May 29 at 4:13 p.m. to investigate an unconscious
person in the driver seat of a vehicle. Officers found a male subject under
the influence of marijuana. The 30-year-old male resident of Philadelphia, was
taken into custody and submitted to a blood test. He was later turned over to
a friend, and charges for DUI are pending.A 42-year-old male resident of
Springfield was arrested and will be charged with DUI and traffic offenses
after being involved in a crash, striking a parked vehicle along the 400 block
Yale Ave., at 2:38 p.m., May 24. The male submitted to a blood test and was
turned over to family.

Disorderly Conduct

A 17-year-old male resident of Springfield was observed in the 300 block
Prospect Rd. running through back yards of properties on May 20 at 2:11 a.m.
The male was found hiding behind a shed and stopped by police. He was cited
for Disorderly Conduct and curfew violations and turned over to his parents.

Theft

A resident of the unit block Indian Rock Dr. reported at 7:34 p.m., May 20,
that sometime during the prior evening someone stole a bicycle from the rear
of his property.The Director of Parks for the Township reported May 22 at 1:15
p.m. that the Ellson Glen Park sign was stolen sometime sometime between May
20 and 22.An unlocked vehicle was entered in the 800 block Homestead Ave. May
24 at 11:01 a.m. and a wallet was removed from inside.An unlocked vehicle in
the 400 block of Kerr Lane was entered and electronics were stolen at 4:41
p.m., May 27.

title: Driver leaves scene after punching bicyclist on West Avenue
html:
Assault

A male subject riding his bicycle in the 1000 block West Ave. reported being assaulted by the driver of a vehicle at 3:05 p.m. May 29. The male said the driver had honked his horn at him while he was riding, and he responded to the driver. The driver then stopped his vehicle and struck the male with his fist. The driver re-entered his vehicle and drove away. The male suffered minor injury. Springfield Township Detective Bridget McCarthy is investigating.

Criminal Mischief

A resident of the 100 block Grandview Rd. reported May 26 that sometime over the weekend someone damaged his mailbox. Witnesses observed a group of juveniles in the area when the mailbox was damaged.

Retail Theft

A witness at CVS, 700 block Baltimore Pike, reported observing a male subject conceal items of merchandise under his shirt and walk out of the store without paying for the merchandise at 1:58 p.m., May 29. The male was observed entering a bus to leave the area. A short distance away the bus was stopped by police and the male identified. Over $375 worth of merchandise was recovered, and the 29-year-old male resident of Chester was taken into custody. He was charged with Retail Theft and held for arraignment.Target security, 800 block of Baltimore Pike, reported a male subject walked out of the store with clothing and failed to pay at 10:04 a.m. May 18. Officers responded and located the subject on Baltimore Pike. Over $430 worth of merchandise was recovered, and a 50-year-old male resident of Philadelphia was taken intocustody and brought to arraignment. He was charged with Retail Theft.Springfield Officers responded to CVS, 300 block of Baltimore Pike, May 19 at 6:32 p.m., for a report of a theft that had just taken place involving two females stealing over $130 worth of merchandise. Both females left the property in a vehicle. A short time later Officer Bergman located the vehicle involved parked in the lot of Target, 800 block Baltimore Pike. He waited and observed the two females from the CVS theft walk to the vehicle. He identified the females, recovered the items from CVS and found they had just stolen merchandise from Target as well. The 29-year-old female resident of Philadelphia was found to have an active arrest warrant out of Delaware County and was transported to the prison. The other 31-year-old female resident of Philadelphia, was released from the scene, and both will be charged with Retail Theft.

DUI

Officers responded to the Springfield Park Shopping Center parking lot, 800 block Baltimore Pike, on May 29 at 4:13 p.m. to investigate an unconscious person in the driver seat of a vehicle. Officers found a male subject under the influence of marijuana. The 30-year-old male resident of Philadelphia, was taken into custody and submitted to a blood test. He was later turned over to a friend, and charges for DUI are pending.A 42-year-old male resident of Springfield was arrested and will be charged with DUI and traffic offenses after being involved in a crash, striking a parked vehicle along the 400 block Yale Ave., at 2:38 p.m., May 24. The male submitted to a blood test and was turned over to family.

Disorderly Conduct

A 17-year-old male resident of Springfield was observed in the 300 block Prospect Rd. running through back yards of properties on May 20 at 2:11 a.m. The male was found hiding behind a shed and stopped by police. He was cited for Disorderly Conduct and curfew violations and turned over to his parents.

Theft

A resident of the unit block Indian Rock Dr. reported at 7:34 p.m., May 20, that sometime during the prior evening someone stole a bicycle from the rear of his property.The Director of Parks for the Township reported May 22 at 1:15 p.m. that the Ellson Glen Park sign was stolen sometime sometime between May 20 and 22.An unlocked vehicle was entered in the 800 block Homestead Ave. May 24 at 11:01 a.m. and a wallet was removed from inside.An unlocked vehicle in the 400 block of Kerr Lane was entered and electronics were stolen at 4:41 p.m., May 27.
